content: This is ridiculous. The media has been obsessing about President Obama's plan to roll back the Bush tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans--from 35% to 39.6%--even asking if that makes him a socialist. But do you know what tax rate the wealthiest Americans paid on the top portion of their earnings at the end of Ronald Reagan's first term? 50%. Under Richard Nixon? 70%. Under Dwight Eisenhower? 91%! Shocking, right? And for all the whining about rolling back Bush's irresponsible tax cuts, the truth is that Obama's plan cuts taxes for 95% of working Americans. Further, it closes huge tax loopholes for oil companies, hedge funds and corporations that ship jobs overseas so that we can invest in the priorities that will get our economy back on track.

content: This is ridiculous. The media has been obsessing about President Obama's plan to roll back the Bush tax cuts for the wealthiest Americans--from 35% to 39.6%--even asking if that makes him a socialist. But do you know what tax rate the wealthiest Americans paid on the top portion of their earnings at the end of Ronald Reagan's first term? 50%. Under Richard Nixon? 70%. Under Dwight Eisenhower? 91%! Shocking, right? And for all the whining about rolling back Bush's irresponsible tax cuts, the truth is that Obama's plan cuts taxes for 95% of working Americans. Further, it closes huge tax loopholes for oil companies, hedge funds and corporations that ship jobs overseas so that we can invest in the priorities that will get our economy back on track.

content: Amusing thread. So Obama is going to raise taxes on the wealthy and their going to pick up their marbles and go somewhere else... What pray tell have they been doing ever since we joined the WTO and NAFTA? How much have these people invested in America compared to what they've invested abroad, and in ponzi schmes like turning mortgages into Bonds? It's NOT Socialism to restrict the ability of Capital to be "Exported" to another country. Forcing Capitalists to invest in America is not the same as expropriatiing their money. It's a solution that Capitalist countries have been using everytime that greed is so rampant that, country be damned in favor of profits. We would STILL be an industrial powerhouse instead of a consumer economy if we had tightened up control of the export of Capital. And it's a about time that we DID tighten up on the export of Capital. Forcing these people who MADE their money here to invest their money here is NOT Socialism. It's plain common sense. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by peter3_1: ERICH, I own exxon stock too. Here's the point, if "cap and trade" (whould be wrack and ruin) takes place, income and corperate taxes are increased as per Mr. Obama, income, profit, and perks will be removed from the USA. Jobs will be lost, the Companies WILL have their annual meetintings at Dubai and so on. Mr. Obama is creating the mood that requires any PRUDENT CEO to take steps to protect capatal. If the tax threats are carried out, to have prudently moved the profit out of reach, and then the persons income protected from confiscation. In the USSR there was a saying, "We pretend to work, they pretend to pay us." It seems that is acceptable to this current administration, but not to me. or to any company I'd own stock in. OK, I am ignorant on CAP and TRADE and I'll need to read up on that now I guess. However, once again I am in the unenviable position of defending President Obama and have to partly side with the liberal position on this issue (yuk!!). President Obama does need to reform taxes on the wealthy and on Corporations. He has been told this by the wealthy and the Corporations themselves believe it or not. When things get so bad that those about to be taxed ask for more taxes......the system is unfair and needs rebalancing, in my opinion. I agree with you to the extent the Pendulum needs to be controlled and not swing too much over into the tax and spend area. Some of the past tax breaks need to be undone though. I do not agree with the theory of redistribution of wealth. However, someone that has 10 times the property that I do, needs to be taxed at 10 times the amount in property taxes that I do because that is their fair share. Likewise, income tax should be proportional to income. There are sensitive issues. Windfall profits tax is a sensitive issue and most Oil Companies think it is BS. They work in a cyclical industry and when profits are below the rate of return they do not get tax brakes to suppliment the Windfall Profits Taxes in good years. So I can see their point. Most CEO's are upset these days that foriegn competitors are not playing under the same set of rules they are forced to play under. So it's not a domestic tax issue. It's a law enforcement issue, sometimes a tarrif issue and sometimes just protectionism. So I don't see increased taxes as a immediate problem.
